keel.Algorithms.Genetic_Rule_Learning.OIGA

Class RuleSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Algorithms.Genetic_Rule_Learning.OIGA.RuleSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable

    public class RuleSet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

    This class represents a set of rules in the OIGA algorithm

    Since:
    JDK 1.5

    Version:
    0.2
    Author:
    Written by Julián Luengo Martín 08/02/2007

      • RuleSet

        public RuleSet()

        Default constructor. No memory allocation

      • RuleSet

        public RuleSet(int numberRules,
               int numAtt)
        Constructor for a fixed number of rules and attributes
        Parameters:
        numberRules - number of rules of the set
        numAtt - number of attributes of each rule

      • RuleSet

        public RuleSet(RuleSet orig)
        Deep-copy constructor
        Parameters:
        orig - the set of rules which will be copied over this set

    • Method Detail

      • createRules

        public void createRules(int numberRules,
                        int numAtt)
        Reset the current rules, and creates a new -clean- set
        Parameters:
        numberRules - number of rules of the set
        numAtt - number of attributes of each rule

      • randomizeRules

        public void randomizeRules(InstanceSet IS)
        Initialize the set of rules
        Parameters:
        IS - train data set used for initialization

      • classify

        public double classify(InstanceSet ISet)
        Classifies the instances of a data sets, and updates the fitness function as the number of well classified instances
        Parameters:
        ISet - the data set that will be classified
        Returns:
        the obtained fitness

      • classify

        public int classify(Instance inst)
        Classifies an instance using the set of rules
        Parameters:
        inst - the instance that will be classified
        Returns:
        the predicted class, or -1 if not covered by any rule (unknown class)

      • copyFromPointtoEnd

        public void copyFromPointtoEnd(RuleSet rs,
                               int cutpoint_rule,
                               int cutpoint_variable)
        Copies the rules from cutpoint to the end of the rule set
        Parameters:
        rs - rule set from which the rules will be copied
        cutpoint_rule - the rule in which there is the cutpoint
        cutpoint_variable - the variable (activation, limits or class) in which the cutpoint is

      • copyFromBegintoPoint

        public void copyFromBegintoPoint(RuleSet rs,
                                 int cutpoint_rule,
                                 int cutpoint_variable)
        Copies the rules from the beginning of the rule set to the selected cutpoint
        Parameters:
        rs - rule set from which the rules will be copied
        cutpoint_rule - the rule in which there is the cutpoint
        cutpoint_variable - the variable (activation, limits or class) in which the cutpoint is

      • mutate

        public void mutate(int gene)
        Mutate a variable of the rule set (i.e. the activation, limits or class of a rule from the rule set)
        Parameters:
        gene - the gene (variable) that will be mutated

      • iga

        public void iga(RuleSet rs)
        Incremental Genetic Algorithm, which increases the size of the actual rule set appending all the attributes from rs to the rules of the actual rule set. The rules used for this task should have the same class as the rule from our rule set, but if we cannot find it, we use any rule.
        Parameters:
        rs - the rule set from which we will append the attributes

      • isEvaluated

        public boolean isEvaluated()
        Test if the rule set is currently evaluated
        Returns:
        if the rule set is evaluated, so its fitness is OK

      • setEvaluated

        public void setEvaluated(boolean eval)
        Returns the evaluation state
        Parameters:
        eval - the evaluation state (true or false) of this rule set

      • getFitness

        public double getFitness()
        Gets the fitness of this rule set
        Returns:
        the current fitness of the rule set (updated or NOT!)

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
        It compares the RuleSet with other one
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
        Parameters:
        o - the rule set to compare
        Returns:
        0 if both rule sets have the same fitness, 1 if the fitness of this is higher, and -1 otherwise

      • equals

        public boolean equals(RuleSet rs)
        Test if the fitness of the rule sets are equal
        Parameters:
        rs - the rule set which will be compared to ours
        Returns:
        if they have equal fitness or not
